channel.title: Should I install Windows Vista?
channel.description:
My uncle is a MSDN subscriber and he said I would let my download Vista on my computer. I know how and I do not need any info on it, but do you think I should do it or stick with XP ?
Edit: And if I get it, should I use IE7, or is Firefox still better + more secure?

item.title: Should I install Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @Rayman266 Rayman266
item.description:
@Rayman266 wrote:

id say leave vista till it comes out on cd (dont know if it has) and if you are installing IE7 make sure you arnt running and other programs (i did that and trashed mypc)[br][size=1]Posted at: May 15, 2006, 03:52:32 pm[/size][hr]for win styles go to… http://www.wincustomize.com

Read full topic

item.title: Should I install Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

search for “windows vista .msstyle” and download.
Then search for dsidebar, and download it. install, there are some skins at it (you can download more anyway)
Go to phazeddl.com and search for internet explorer 7. there’s a cracked version aroundsomewhere

for the start menu search box,i have no idea

item.title: Should I install Windows Vista?

item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Ugh... I hate Macs... If I decide not to use Windows then I will switch to Linux. It is easy + free + MUCH more stable than Mac.

I how in a Mac, if one program freezes then the entire OS crashes.

item.title: Should I install Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @Polaris Polaris
item.description:
@Polaris wrote:

daycrawler:

Vista isn't good... Wonder why it took windows 6 years to come out with better editions then xp? It was so behind in it's other project that it dropped it because it had soo many errors... Vista is so far behind in Apple's programming. Apple is the way to go if your going to convert.....

If only companies wouldn't be like "I R micosofty all teh way, i onlay maketh apps fo micosofty!!" "Im Gonna go wit MAC cuz itz coolier, so windoze can't uze itz" -.-;; but it all comes down to 3 things "Memory management, versatility, and price." Is what im trying to say is OSX would be GREAT if companys would develope more apps for it that work only for windows atm. Back to topic, Vista is turning out to be the new Windows ME (If ya know what I mean...)

Read full topic

item.title: Should I install Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @Polaris Polaris
item.description:
@Polaris wrote:

SomethingToHide:

I've downloaded all of my music via BearShare, and iTunes lets me play it O.o

DRM is still in its testing stages, if you've ever noticed when you download a song from limewire/bearshear(both gnutella networks*I think*) nd you go and try to play it in WMP10, it will sometimes say "File is corrupt or un-readable" Thats DRM beta for ya. Yet if you go to play it in WinAmp, it works perfectly. Vista plans to fix not only some of the songs that still plays in WMP... but make it so for other apps to run on vista they need to add DRM too! Damn corporate comps trying to take away freedom! Anyways, you know theres going to be cracks, hacks, bypass's n stuff Another thing Vista's planning on is for even HARDWARE, yes hardware, to be DRM protected to use with Windows Vista. The only thing that i think their going to have problems with is getting old cd's without licences to run on vista. Its kinda hard to say good things about vista, especially about what jcs_double posted about memory leaks, your pc could run like a 450lb kid in the 50m run, even if its a 512-1gig, 64bit, badboy.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I install Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Zach1188:

Crap, I mounted the WinVista DVD with Daemon tools, and I did the upgrade instead of fresh install. The problem is Daemon tools does not seem to be compatible with Vista, so in the first reboot, daemon tools stopped working, and it could not read the fake DVD. Now the stupid thing wont boot, so I have to reinstall Windows XP + redownload the torrent, and put it on a real DVD.

Btw, I am new to using DVDs, I use CDs. I got a pack of DVDs, and I cannot save files to it. It seems to be in a format like a music CD (It has one track). So is there a program I can use to format it like a regular CD?

Lol, what did you expected? Daemon tools w'n't run in DOS. Burn the ISO to a dvd, and THEN install

Read full topic

item.title: Should I install Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Crap, I mounted the WinVista DVD with Daemon tools, and I did the upgrade instead of fresh install. The problem is Daemon tools does not seem to be compatible with Vista, so in the first reboot, daemon tools stopped working, and it could not read the fake DVD. Now the stupid thing wont boot, so I have to reinstall Windows XP + redownload the torrent, and put it on a real DVD.

Btw, I am new to using DVDs, I use CDs. I got a pack of DVDs, and I cannot save files to it. It seems to be in a format like a music CD (It has one track). So is there a program I can use to format it like a regular CD?

Read full topic

item.title: Should I install Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @Polaris Polaris
item.description:
@Polaris wrote:

DRM - Digital Rights Management http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_rights_management EVERYTHING you need to know about DRM there. (Sorry if its against rules to post links) DRM pretty much controlls every media file on your computer,(Doesnt let you play unlicenced media ex. p2p music d/ls) and blocking access to media, iTunes is even bundle'd with it.

Read full topic
